maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new alias property definition.
An alias property defines a new name for an existing property.
Name of this member
The name of the referenced property that this alias refers to.
Set true if the member is supposed to be hidden
The full name of the .NET Framework type of the referenced property value.
Set true if the member is supposed to be hidden
The name of the referenced property that this alias refers to.
The full name of the .NET Framework type of the referenced property value.
Name of this member
Creates a new code method definition.
A code method references a static method of a .NET Framework object.
Name of this member
The code reference for this code method. Code references instances can be created using the New-CodeReference cmdlet.
The code reference for this code method. Code references instances can be created using the New-CodeReference cmdlet.
Name of this member
Creates a new code property definition.
A code property references a static property of a .NET Framework object.
Name of this member
The code reference for this accessor. Code references instances can be created using the New-CodeReference cmdlet.
The code reference for this accessor. Code references instances can be created using the New-CodeReference cmdlet.
Set true if the member is supposed to be hidden
The code reference for this accessor. Code references instances can be created using the New-CodeReference cmdlet.
Set true if the member is supposed to be hidden
The code reference for this accessor. Code references instances can be created using the New-CodeReference cmdlet.
Name of this member
Creates a new code reference.
Code references can be used as parameter values in the New-CodeMethod and New-CodeProperty cmdlets.
Defines the .NET type name that this code reference refers to
Defines the .NET method name that this code reference refers to
Defines the .NET method name that this code reference refers to
Defines the .NET type name that this code reference refers to
Creates a new member set definition.
The PSStandardMembers member set is used by Windows PowerShell to define the default property sets for an object.
Name of this member
Defines the members for this memberset

Inheriting members tells this MemberSet to walk the TypeNames during a lookup of members. This means that any members of a parent type that are in a MemberSet of the same name will be available through this MemberSet. Setting this switch turns off this behaviour.
Set true if the member is supposed to be hidden

Inheriting members tells this MemberSet to walk the TypeNames during a lookup of members. This means that any members of a parent type that are in a MemberSet of the same name will be available through this MemberSet. Setting this switch turns off this behaviour.
Set true if the member is supposed to be hidden
Defines the members for this memberset
Name of this member

A note property defines a property that has a static value.

The (static) value for this note property

The (static) value for this note property

A property set defines a group of extended properties that can be referenced by the name of the set.

Defines the properties that this property set references

Defines the properties that this property set references

Adds a type to a type file structure, as a container for subsequent member definitions.
Name for this type.
A script block that evaluates to the members of this type.
Optional type converter for this type. Pass in either a string containing the type converter type name, or a TypeConverter instance.
A script block that evaluates to the members of this type.
Name for this type.
Optional type converter for this type. Pass in either a string containing the type converter type name, or a TypeConverter instance.
Creates a new type converter.
Type converters can be used as a parameter value in the New-Type cmdlet.
The type name for this type converter.
The type name for this type converter.
Creates a new type file structure.
Types files are XML-based files that let you add PowerShell properties and methods to existing .NET objects.
A script block whose contents evaluate to Type objects.

Text to be emitted before the actual type data, such as an XML declaration specifying the encoding. When specifying an encoding in -PreContent, make sure you use the same encoding when sending the cmdlet's output to a file or stream.

Text to be emitted before the actual type data, such as an XML declaration specifying the encoding. When specifying an encoding in -PreContent, make sure you use the same encoding when sending the cmdlet's output to a file or stream.
A script block whose contents evaluate to Type objects.
